[[James Hird]] ({{AFL Ess}}) | prevseason = [[1995 AFL season|1995]] | nextseason = [[1997 AFL season|1997]] }} Results and statistics for the '''[[Australian Football League]] season of 1996'''. ''See [[List of Australian Football League premiers]] for a complete list.'' ==AFL Draft== ''See [[1996 AFL Draft]] for more information.'' ==Lighting Premiership== In the [[1996 AFL Lightning Premiership]] final, {{AFL Ess}} defeated {{AFL BB}} 6.11 (47) to 2.9 (21) at [[Waverley Park]]. ==National Cup== In the [[1996 Ansett Australia Cup]] final, {{AFL StK}} defeated {{AFL Car}} 20.10 (130) to 10.12 (72) in front of 66,888 at Waverley Park. ==Premiership Season== ===Round 1=== {{start box}} |- bgcolor="#CCCCFF" | '''Home team''' | '''Score''' | '''Away team''' | '''Score''' | Total |- | Essendon || 11 || 49,526 || 87,549 || 15,794 || 544,789 |- | Collingwood || 11 || 44,723 || 71,663 || 21,126 || 491,953 |- | Adelaide || 11 || 39,428 || 45,266 || 31,880 || 433,713 |- | Richmond || 11 || 38,624 || 61,740 || 17,157 || 424,859 |- | Carlton || 11 || 35,891 || 70,152 || 15,277 || 394,802 |- | North Melbourne || 11 || 34,627 || 68,537 || 15,453 || 380,899 |- | West Coast || 11 || 32,448 || 40,085 || 22,044 || 356,932 |- | Melbourne || 11 || 30,315 || 63,196 || 8747 || 333,465 |- | St Kilda || 11 || 27,137 || 43,925 || 13,824 || 298,512 |- | Geelong || 11 || 25,161 || 50,074 || 17,538 || 276,775 |- | Sydney || 11 || 24,574 || 44,047 || 10,965 || 270,309 |- | Hawthorn || 11 || 23,624 || 38,263 || 14,286 || 259,868 |- | Fremantle || 11 || 22,473 || 33,041 || 17,513 || 247,204 |- | Brisbane || 11 || 18,088 || 21,644 || 14,222 || 198,968 |- | Footscray || 11 || 18,073 || 36,766 || 7677 || 198,800 |- | Fitzroy || 11 || 9482 || 13,497 || 5083 || 104,300 |- | Totals || 176 || 29,637 || 87,549 || 5083 || 5216,148 |- |} {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Venue !! Hosted !! Average !! Highest !! Lowest !! Total |- | MCG || 51 || 46,114 || 87,549 || 15,494 || 2351,808 |- | Football Park || 11 || 39,428 || 45,266 || 31,880 || 433,713 |- | Subiaco Oval || 16 || 28,289 || 40,085 || 17,513 || 452,616 |- | Waverley Park || 24 || 25,545 || 43,925 || 13,824 || 613,079 |- | WACA || 6 || 25,253 || 31,411 || 19,360 || 151,520 |- | SCG || 11 || 24,574 || 44,047 || 10,965 || 270,309 |- | Victoria Park || 4 || 23,581 || 26,459 || 21,126 || 94,322 |- | Kardinia Park || 10 || 22,670 || 27,659 || 17,538 || 226,701 |- | GABBA || 11 || 18,088 || 21,644 || 14,222 || 198,968 |- | Optus Oval || 17 || 15,641 || 21,674 || 6469 || 265,892 |- | Whitten Oval || 15 || 10,482 || 16,804 || 5083 || 157,224 |- | Totals || 176 || 29,637 || 87,549 || 5083 || 5216,148 |} ==Awards== *The [[Brownlow Medal]] was awarded to [[Michael Voss]] of {{AFL BB}} and [[James Hird]] of {{AFL Ess}}. *The [[Leigh Matthews Trophy]] was awarded to [[Corey McKernan]] of {{AFL Nor}}. *The [[Coleman Medal]] was awarded to [[Tony Lockett]] of {{AFL Syd}}. *The [[Norm Smith Medal]] was awarded to [[Glenn Archer]] of {{AFL Nor}}. *The [[AFL Rising Star award]] was awarded to [[Ben Cousins]] of {{AFL WC}}. *The [[Wooden Spoon (award)|Wooden Spoon]] was "awarded" to {{AFL Fit}} in their final season before the club merged with the {{AFL BB}}. ==Notes== * The Round 10 game between {{AFL StK}} and {{AFL Ess}} was interrupted at the twenty minute mark of the third quarter when [[Waverley Park]] lost power, causing the floodlights to go off. The remaining quarter and a bit was played three nights later. ** Subsequently, the AFL introduced contingencies that a game could be abandoned, with the progress result accepted as final at any point beyond half time, at the agreement of the captains when (a) any unexpected incident delays a game by half an hour, or (b) if dangerous weather conditions, most typically lightning, prevail. * {{AFL Nor}} received a special gold-coloured premiership cup, instead of the typical silver, to signify what the AFL had represented as its Centenary Season throughout 1996. (Note: 1996 was the VFL/AFL's ''hundredth season'', which by strictest definition is not the same as the centenary season which would have been 1997). * The season is perhaps best remembered for its preliminary final between minor premiers {{AFL Syd}} and sixth-placed {{AFL Ess}}. With scores level on 10.9 (69), Sydney's [[Tony Lockett]] scored a behind with a kick after the siren to win the game. **Lockett had been under an injury cloud with a groin problem during the preceding week, and there was some doubt whether he would play. The Swans' victory led a Sydney journalist to comment that "All week we have been concentrating on Lockett's groin, when we now know it was his behind that counted." ==References== * [http://stats.rleague.com/afl/seas/1996.html 1996 Season - AFL Tables] {{VFL/AFL_seasons}} {{DEFAULTSORT:1996 Afl Season}} [[Category:1996 in Australian rules football|AFL season]] [[Category:Australian Football League seasons]]
